definition: To expose an enclosed space to fresh air, typically by opening windows or doors, in order to ventilate and refresh the atmosphere inside. This action is commonly performed in various indoor settings, such as homes, offices, or classrooms, to improve air quality and circulation.

examples.german: Ich lüfte das Zimmer, um frische Luft hereinzulassen.
examples.english: I am airing the room to let fresh air in.

examples.german: Bitte lüfte regelmäßig, um die Luftqualität zu verbessern.
examples.english: Please ventilate regularly to improve air quality.

examples.german: Lüfte den Raum, bevor du mit dem Streichen beginnst.
examples.english: Ventilate the room before you start painting.

examples.german: Es ist wichtig, das Auto nach dem Waschen gut zu lüften.
examples.english: It is important to air out the car well after washing it.

examples.german: Lüfte das Schlafzimmer vor dem Zubettgehen, um besser schlafen zu können.
examples.english: Air out the bedroom before going to bed to sleep better.
